list.name: Changes
list.comment: Fixed error with remove / add on watchlist at startup

task.summary: Default task

Updated more to the searchResultDisplay method in SearchBar and the only thing left is to add action listeners to the JButtons. I also updated some private variables within the class and updated the constructor a bit. It still needs some fixing because it is not displaying properly when main is ran during testing.

Updated more to the searchResultDisplay method in SearchBar and the only thing left is to add action listeners to the JButtons. I also updated some private variables within the class and updated the constructor a bit. It still needs some fixing because it is not displaying properly when main is ran during testing.
Made SearchBar extend JFrame because it should be if it's using a JFrame as the base item.
Fixed the frame not showing, tweaked some sizes, ADD kicking in while studying sorry...
I changed from JButtons for the search results to a JComboBox and omg it feels so much nicer. ADD kicked in again while studying.......
I changed from JButtons for the search results to a JComboBox and omg it feels so much nicer. ADD kicked in again while studying.......
Updated the SearchBarBackEnd searchResults method to take in another String that will be used as a filter selection later on.
Updated the SearchBarBackEnd searchResults method to take in another String that will be used as a filter selection later on.
Look what my ADD did to me at 430AM-5AM, Load a movies WIKI page PACMAN FTW. If you hate it just change it LOL
Look what my ADD did to me at 430AM-5AM, Load a movies WIKI page. If you hate it just change it LOL

Mouse Icon spins when loading things, if you need to add it somewhere, just call UserInterface.loading and UserInterface.doneLoading. Created the UI portion to the AdvancedFilterUI. I'll rework SearchBarBackEnd to work with this, but it's going to be a bitch.
Didn't like the first version of the AdvancedFilterUI, so I edited it. I'll refactor it later.
Fixed load() method within WatchList to load json file when a hashmap was used to popualte it. @Hudson
Fixed load() method within WatchList to load json file when a hashmap was used to popualte it. @Hudson
Re-built project because of some weird glitch where SeaerchBarBackEnd wasn't registering as there.

Built onto backend more, but needs updated to handle advanced search option. Added generic search options of Movies, Titles, and TV Series. Then one more option of advanced that will now display the actual advanced search box. The method to handle what is selected has been built, but is being worked on further. The rest I forgot, so just look at differences.

Update: I am done with advanced search. I, at this moment, hate advanced search and all it took....................................... Wayyyy too long... I am done for this week. Gl with testing it, I am sorry for the confusing ass advancedSearchMethod() and how the URL is actually formed. I also updated an exception in WatchList because when you would remove from watchlist, it would give you an index out of bounds. I made it return null when it was zero in the list and if someone tried removing something. Then handled the null pointer exception. I also kept my print statement, that I used to test my own code, in the code itself, so you can visualize how I am making the URL to the API. I have included a JOptionPane that will pop up if no search results are found. This happens with advanced search mostly.
I've moved classes where they were supposed to go AKA UI/LIB/SRC folders
Last push, I updated search results loading to work.
Fixed project's dependencies.

Updates to DisplayTrailer method and class. There is a bug, and it might lie with the button of display trailer or with DisplayTrailer class / method, but I'm not sure. But when the button is clicked with different movies it seems as if the button is duplicating with each new movie clicked.
House keeping aka some refactoring.
swt for aarch64 disappeared when I pulled to my mac. Had to add back.

Testing what I could for SWTJarSelector. Also, JarClassLoader is untestable as its mainly calling the parent class that it extends, which was created/test by who ever upkeep's the java library. The class alone is just a workaround to add a Jar to the class path during runtime.

I created a way for Mac users to experience the movie trailer off of their default browsers. I also did refactoring using checkstyle and I deleted random Sout prints throughout the programs.... Lastly, I tested the files I created. No functionality was changed for Window users.

Updated ProgramExecution with look and feel attributes of Nimbus and changed the color scheme. Deleted methods not being used in UserInterface. I created a method within UserInterface to handle the creation of the home/trailer buttons. If you touch my color scheme in ProgramExecution, I will freak out. It took me too long to figure out what went where.
Made the menu items workable with everything besides theme atm.

Made the themes of JMU/IMDB/Default/Dark Mode work. There is one issue where the scroll bar on the JScrollPane of the wiki page updates the first time and then doesn't update from there on out. Idk how to fix it. If you want to do your theme, then copy and paste everything I did in each menuitems action listener and add your new menuitem to the parameters and the JMenu of options.
Fixed error with remove / add on watchlist at startup

MESSAGE.value: Made SearchBar extend JFrame because it should be if it's using a JFrame as the base item.
Fixed the frame not showing, tweaked some sizes, ADD kicking in while studying sorry...
I changed from JButtons for the search results to a JComboBox and omg it feels so much nicer. ADD kicked in again while studying.......
Updated the SearchBarBackEnd searchResults method to take in another String that will be used as a filter selection later on.
Look what my ADD did to me at 430AM-5AM, Load a movies WIKI page PACMAN FTW. If you hate it just change it LOL
Look what my ADD did to me at 430AM-5AM, Load a movies WIKI page. If you hate it just change it LOL

Mouse Icon spins when loading things, if you need to add it somewhere, just call UserInterface.loading and UserInterface.doneLoading. Created the UI portion to the AdvancedFilterUI. I'll rework SearchBarBackEnd to work with this, but it's going to be a bitch.
Didn't like the first version of the AdvancedFilterUI, so I edited it. I'll refactor it later.
Fixed load() method within WatchList to load json file when a hashmap was used to popualte it. @Hudson
Re-built project because of some weird glitch where SeaerchBarBackEnd wasn't registering as there.

Built onto backend more, but needs updated to handle advanced search option. Added generic search options of Movies, Titles, and TV Series. Then one more option of advanced that will now display the actual advanced search box. The method to handle what is selected has been built, but is being worked on further. The rest I forgot, so just look at differences.

Update: I am done with advanced search. I, at this moment, hate advanced search and all it took....................................... Wayyyy too long... I am done for this week. Gl with testing it, I am sorry for the confusing ass advancedSearchMethod() and how the URL is actually formed. I also updated an exception in WatchList because when you would remove from watchlist, it would give you an index out of bounds. I made it return null when it was zero in the list and if someone tried removing something. Then handled the null pointer exception. I also kept my print statement, that I used to test my own code, in the code itself, so you can visualize how I am making the URL to the API. I have included a JOptionPane that will pop up if no search results are found. This happens with advanced search mostly.
I've moved classes where they were supposed to go AKA UI/LIB/SRC folders
Last push, I updated search results loading to work.
Fixed project's dependencies.

Updates to DisplayTrailer method and class. There is a bug, and it might lie with the button of display trailer or with DisplayTrailer class / method, but I'm not sure. But when the button is clicked with different movies it seems as if the button is duplicating with each new movie clicked.
House keeping aka some refactoring.
swt for aarch64 disappeared when I pulled to my mac. Had to add back.

Testing what I could for SWTJarSelector. Also, JarClassLoader is untestable as its mainly calling the parent class that it extends, which was created/test by who ever upkeep's the java library. The class alone is just a workaround to add a Jar to the class path during runtime.

I created a way for Mac users to experience the movie trailer off of their default browsers. I also did refactoring using checkstyle and I deleted random Sout prints throughout the programs.... Lastly, I tested the files I created. No functionality was changed for Window users.

Updated ProgramExecution with look and feel attributes of Nimbus and changed the color scheme. Deleted methods not being used in UserInterface. I created a method within UserInterface to handle the creation of the home/trailer buttons. If you touch my color scheme in ProgramExecution, I will freak out. It took me too long to figure out what went where.
Made the menu items workable with everything besides theme atm.

Made the themes of JMU/IMDB/Default/Dark Mode work. There is one issue where the scroll bar on the JScrollPane of the wiki page updates the first time and then doesn't update from there on out. Idk how to fix it. If you want to do your theme, then copy and paste everything I did in each menuitems action listener and add your new menuitem to the parameters and the JMenu of options.
